quizSynopsis: Test your knowledge of Python, Linux, Git, Bash, and Docker fundamentals.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a basic Python concept?
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! System calls are not part of basic Python concepts.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. System calls are not a basic Python concept.

questions.question: What is the main advantage of learning a real programming language like Python?
answers: It allows you to replace Bash scripts completely.
It helps you adapt to the developer mindset.
It is exclusively used in DevOps.
It is easier than learning Bash.
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! Python helps in adopting a developer mindset.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. Python is not just about ease of use; it's about thinking like a developer.

questions.question: Which of the following is a common feature of development tools?
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! All of these are features of development tools.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. Development tools offer all these features.

questions.question: Which of the following is the primary purpose of Bash scripting in DevOps?
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! Bash scripting is commonly used to automate repetitive tasks.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. The primary purpose of Bash scripting in DevOps is to automate repetitive tasks.

questions.question: What does the 'cd' command do in Linux?
answers: Displays the contents of a file
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! 'cd' is used to change the current directory.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. 'cd' changes the current directory.

questions.question: Which version control system is commonly used in DevOps to manage source code?
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! Git is widely used in DevOps for version control.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. Git is the most commonly used version control system in DevOps.

questions.question: What is the purpose of Docker in DevOps?
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! Docker is used to containerize applications.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. Docker is primarily used for containerizing applications.

questions.question: Which command is used to check the status of the current branch in Git?
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! 'git status' shows the status of the current branch.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. 'git status' is the correct command to check the branch status.

questions.question: Which of the following is an advantage of using Docker?
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! Docker provides easier package management, faster deployment, and consistent environments.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. Docker offers all of these advantages.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'chmod' command in Linux?
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! 'chmod' is used to change file permissions.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. 'chmod' changes file permissions.

questions.question: Which Docker command is used to list all running containers?
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! 'docker ps' lists all running containers.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. Use 'docker ps' to list running containers.

questions.question: What is a repository in Git?
answers: A place to store code changes
A place to store Docker images
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! A repository is used to store code changes in Git.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. A repository in Git stores code changes.

questions.question: Which command is used to add changes to the staging area in Git?
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! 'git add' is used to add changes to the staging area.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. 'git add' adds changes to the staging area.

questions.question: What is the function of the 'ls' command in Linux?
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! 'ls' lists the contents of a directory.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. 'ls' is used to list directory contents.

questions.question: Which of the following is true about Docker images?
answers: They contain everything needed to run an application.
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! Docker images contain all dependencies needed to run an application.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. Docker images contain everything needed to run an application.

questions.question: What does the 'pwd' command do in Linux?
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! 'pwd' prints the current working directory.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. 'pwd' prints the current directory.

questions.question: Which command is used to commit changes in Git?
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! 'git commit' is used to save changes to the local repository.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. 'git commit' saves changes to the local repository.

questions.question: What is a container in the context of Docker?
answers: An isolated environment to run an application
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! A container is an isolated environment to run an application.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. A container is an isolated environment to run an application.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a Git command?
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! 'git container' is not a valid Git command.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. 'git container' is not a valid Git command.

questions.question: What does the 'rm' command do in Linux?
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! 'rm' is used to remove a file.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. 'rm' removes a file.

questions.question: What is the purpose of 'git push'?
answers: To save changes to the local repository
To send changes to a remote repository
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! 'git push' sends changes to a remote repository.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. 'git push' is used to send changes to a remote repository.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a Linux distribution?
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! Windows is not a Linux distribution.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. Windows is not a Linux distribution.

questions.question: Which command is used to create a new directory in Linux?
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! 'mkdir' is used to create a new directory.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. 'mkdir' creates a new directory.

questions.question: Which Git command is used to create a new branch?
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! 'git branch' is used to create a new branch.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. 'git branch' creates a new branch.

questions.question: What is the purpose of 'sudo' in Linux?
answers: To execute a command with superuser privileges
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! 'sudo' allows you to execute commands with superuser privileges.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. 'sudo' is used to execute commands with superuser privileges.

questions.question: Which Docker command is used to build an image from a Dockerfile?
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! 'docker build' is used to build an image from a Dockerfile.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. 'docker build' builds an image from a Dockerfile.

questions.question: What is the default port for SSH?
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! The default port for SSH is 22.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. The default port for SSH is 22.

questions.question: Which command is used to display the current working directory in Linux?
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! 'pwd' displays the current working directory.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. 'pwd' displays the current working directory.

questions.question: Which of the following is a container orchestration tool?
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! Kubernetes is a container orchestration tool.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. Kubernetes is a container orchestration tool.

questions.question: What does 'git clone' do?
answers: Copies an existing repository to your local machine
Adds changes to the staging area
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! 'git clone' copies an existing repository to your local machine.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. 'git clone' copies an existing repository to your local machine.

questions.question: Which Linux command is used to view the contents of a file?
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! 'cat' is used to view the contents of a file.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. 'cat' is used to view the contents of a file.

questions.question: What is a commit in Git?
answers: A snapshot of changes in the repository
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! A commit is a snapshot of changes in the repository.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. A commit is a snapshot of changes in the repository.

questions.question: Which command is used to rename a file in Linux?
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! 'mv' is used to rename a file.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. 'mv' renames a file.

questions.question: Which command is used to stop a running Docker container?
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! 'docker stop' is used to stop a running container.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. 'docker stop' stops a running container.

questions.question: What is a fork in Git?
answers: A copy of a repository to your own GitHub account
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! A fork is a copy of a repository to your own GitHub account.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. A fork is a copy of a repository to your own GitHub account.

questions.question: Which of the following is a Linux package manager?
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! 'apt' is a package manager used in Linux.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. 'apt' is a package manager used in Linux.

questions.question: What does 'docker pull' do?
answers: Downloads an image from a registry
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! 'docker pull' downloads an image from a registry.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. 'docker pull' downloads an image from a registry.

questions.question: Which command is used to update package lists in Debian-based Linux systems?
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! 'apt-get update' updates package lists in Debian-based systems.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. 'apt-get update' updates package lists in Debian-based systems.

questions.question: What does the 'head' command do in Linux?
answers: Displays the first few lines of a file
Displays the last few lines of a file
Deletes the first few lines of a file
Edits the first few lines of a file
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! 'head' displays the first few lines of a file.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. 'head' displays the first few lines of a file.

questions.question: Which of the following is used to manage Docker containers in production?
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! Kubernetes is often used to manage Docker containers in production.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. Kubernetes is used to manage Docker containers in production.
